etymologies: mid 16th century: perhaps from Arabic al-lāmī

definitions: an oleoresin obtained from a tropical tree and used in varnishes, ointments, and aromatherapy.

notes.text: This resin is obtained from several trees in the family Burseraceae, in particular Burserasimaruba (producing American elemi) and Canarium luzanicum (producing Manila elemi)

shortDefinitions: oleoresin obtained from tropical tree and used in varnishes and aromatherapy
